intro: Aster lasiophaeus, commonly known as the roughleaf aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as meadows, marshes, and stream banks. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers in the fall. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by composite flower heads and a variety of ecological roles. Aster lasiophaeus is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinator populations.
